intro: Triuris hyalina, commonly known as the glassy triuris, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its delicate, translucent leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Triuris hyalina is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
